meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>disaster</kanji> that is <kanji>difficult</kanji> is particularly difficult, making it more of a <vocabulary>misfortune</vocabulary>. Obviously a disaster that wasn't difficult wouldn't really be that bad, so a difficult one gets the "misfortune" or <vocabulary>calamity</vocabulary> label.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
